testimony.threat_quote: warned him to watch that cats did not get a little 'jallat'

timeline.subject: Agnes Marcoussan
timeline.details: 'la belle Agnes' confronted with Barbon femme Nicolas Moictrier, who accused her and maintained charges up to moment of her own execution

timeline.subject: Agnes Marcoussan
timeline.details: Rémy orders secret investigation; if this produces charges she is to be arrested and interrogated

timeline.subject: Agnes Marcoussan
timeline.details: First interrogation - she denied all charges

timeline.subject: Agnes Marcoussan
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses - she denied all charges

timeline.subject: Agnes Marcoussan
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to torture

timeline.subject: Agnes Marcoussan
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - thumbscrews, racked 3 turns, threatened with strappado and weights. She confessed nothing.

timeline.subject: Agnes Marcoussan
timeline.details: Rémy asks that she be renvoyée jusqu'a rappel (released pending recall). Change de Nancy approves same day.

timeline.subject: Agnes Marcoussan
timeline.details: Court at St Nicolas orders her release

prior_accusations.context: Accused Agnes before her own execution

notable_quotes.speaker: Agnes Marcoussan
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle ferait beaucoup pour elle que de s'y comporter plus modestement que de passé
notable_quotes.english: she would do much for herself by behaving more modestly than in the past

notable_quotes.speaker: Agnes Marcoussan to daughter's cock
notable_quotes.french: Sy le votre at longue vie il sera bon
notable_quotes.english: If yours has a long life it will be good

notable_quotes.speaker: Agnes Marcoussan
notable_quotes.french: toutesfois que la fille de luy deposant nommée Mathillon les payeroit bien sans qu'elle en sache rien
notable_quotes.english: however the daughter of the witness named Mathillon will pay well without her knowing anything
notable_quotes.context: Threat during rent dispute with Jean Maxeray

notable_quotes.speaker: Agnes Marcoussan
notable_quotes.french: on a bien esté querir le maitre des genaix, pour scavoir de sa maladie, mais on ne l'a pas trouvé
notable_quotes.english: they went to seek the master of genaix to know about her illness, but they did not find him

notable_quotes.speaker: Agnes Marcoussan
notable_quotes.french: pour qui travaille je, je ne scay
notable_quotes.english: for whom do I work, I do not know
notable_quotes.context: When she became ill working in the fields after hearing about Barbon's accusations

notable_quotes.speaker: Agnes Marcoussan
notable_quotes.french: Sy vous m'eussiez dict que vous aviez opinion que j'aye faict mourir votre vache, vostre cheval ne fut pas morte
notable_quotes.english: If you had told me you had the opinion that I caused your cow to die, your horse would not have died
notable_quotes.context: Reply to Anne Charpentier after being called a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Agnes Marcoussan
notable_quotes.context: When threatened with burning by Anne Charpentier

notable_quotes.speaker: Agnes Marcoussan
notable_quotes.french: que sy l'on daignoit parler aux voisins l'on pourroit bien trouver quelque remede
notable_quotes.english: if one deigned to speak to the neighbors one could well find some remedy
notable_quotes.context: Comment to Joseph Vigneulle about his daughter's eye trouble

notable_quotes.speaker: Agnes Marcoussan
notable_quotes.french: taisez-vous, dieu luy renvoyera sa santé
notable_quotes.english: be quiet, God will restore her health
notable_quotes.context: To Catherine Vigneulle crying about child's illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Agnes Marcoussan
notable_quotes.french: cela ne peult tourner en consequence qu'elle soit cause du mal d'aultant que ce sont accidens qui arrive souvent aux femmes et que le remede n'est incogneu a touttes
notable_quotes.english: this cannot turn into a consequence that she is the cause of the evil inasmuch as these are accidents that often happen to women and the remedy is not unknown to all
notable_quotes.context: Defense about suggesting fennel remedy for loss of milk

notable_quotes.speaker: Agnes Marcoussan
notable_quotes.french: que c'est une injure comme que les jeunes gens donnent aux vieilles gens et que l'on luy faict grand tort
notable_quotes.english: it is an insult that young people give to old people and that they do her great wrong
notable_quotes.context: Response to being called a witch by miller's wife

notable_quotes.speaker: Agnes Marcoussan
notable_quotes.french: voila un belle recompence que tu me donne de tant de bien que je toy faict et a ton marit
notable_quotes.english: there is a fine reward you give me for so much good I did for you and your husband
notable_quotes.context: To Catherine le Goeulx during confrontation

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbon to Agnes
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle s'en souviendroit quelque jour. Qu'elle at dampné son ame en la chargeant innocement
notable_quotes.english: that she would remember it someday. That she has damned her soul by charging her innocently
notable_quotes.context: Barbon's words after quarrel at the mill

by whom she had a daughter who was still alive
la fille de luy deposant nommée Mathillon

Agnes had been nursing one of her children

economic_context.details: Multiple rent disputes: 6 gros dispute with Jean Maxeray over hens for marriage feast and rent; dispute over 1 gros with Nicolas Bonnier for shoe mending; expelled from lodging by Anne Charpentier. Economic precarity evident from day labor work and nursing/healing to supplement income. Agnes worked in fields harvesting, did day labor, and provided nursing services.

horse covered with spots 'comme frezain', then died

emotional_state_notes: withstood rack and torture without confessing
did not show emotion when threatened with burning: 'elle ne fit jamais contenance de s'esmouvoir'
became distressed in fields when hearing about Barbon's accusations: 'toute esperdue' and refused to eat

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: denied hearing noise that Vigneulle's claimed; Catherine Vigneulle claimed Agnes begged her not to tell Jean Maxerey about noise, Agnes denied this

argued about whether she had been to baptism; said even if she suggested fennel remedy 'cela ne peult tourner en consequence qu'elle soit cause du mal d'aultant que ce sont accidens qui arrive souvent aux femmes et que le remede n'est incogneu a touttes'
admitted pulling hair in dispute with Nicolle Noel but said being called witch 'que c'est une injure comme que les jeunes gens donnent aux vieilles gens et que l'on luy faict grand tort'
said 'voila un belle recompence que tu me donne de tant de bien que je toy faict et a ton marit'

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a remarkable case where Agnes Marcoussan was RELEASED after withstanding torture. She never confessed despite being racked 3 turns and threatened with strappado. The trial shows extensive evidence of her role as a healer/cunning woman - she was consulted for remedies, performed counter-magic (the bread and salt cure), and had a 'mistress' (Hellenix) who taught her divination and healing. The nickname 'la belle Agnes' is notable. Many witnesses actually described her HEALING people and animals (calming wild horses by touch, suggesting remedies that worked), which was then reinterpreted as evidence she had caused the original harm. The economic precarity is evident throughout - multiple disputes over tiny sums (1 gros, 6 gros), day labor work, expulsion from housing. Her emotional collapse in the fields ('pour qui travaille je, je ne scay' and refusing to eat) when she learned of the accusations is poignant. The fact she was ultimately released is highly unusual and may reflect: (1) her steadfast denials under torture, (2) lack of confession, (3) her role as a known healer in the community, (4) possible intervention given her connection to maire Bason's wife. The Change de Nancy approved torture but then approved her release 'jusqu'a rappel' (pending recall), suggesting uncertainty about the case. Age 57, two marriages, worked as nurse and healer. Language region: French (St Nicolas, Lorraine).
